title: Guest Services Coordinator - US Remote
description:
At Blueground, we are guided by a vision to make people feel at home wherever they choose to live. By offering fully-furnished apartments that are move-in ready in the world’s most vibrant neighborhoods, we provide our guests with the opportunity to simply #ShowUpStartLiving. Behind the scenes, we strive for a tech-powered living experience that guests love, homed in an organization where great people are proud to work.

We’ve grown a lot since our founding in 2013. We are now hosting guests in more than 4,000 homes in 15 cities. We have raised more than $100m+ in funding to date and that’s just the beginning

What drives our success is how each of our team members applies our core values. To our team, Time is everything, and we cherish it greatly. For us, Excellence isn’t simply a standard, but an exciting way to look at life. We Care deeply about our clients and colleagues and never lose sight of the human element, which goes hand-in-hand with Transparency which we believe makes our day-to-day life easier.

We are looking to recruit a Guest Services Coordinator to be based anywhere in the US. The focus is placed on receiving clients' issues and fulfilling their requests while handling multiple tasks, setting priorities, and demonstrating time management.

The role is a great opportunity for a hard-working and talented person to gain a real insight into the hospitality industry. If you're someone who possesses sound experience in customer success, team coordination and problem-solving, and you like to interact with internal and external customers across the business, then this role is for you!

While there are core working hours that include weekends this is a salaried position that requires flexibility to meet business needs.

What you will focus on:

  • Receiving complex inquiries from guests and then deciding the right way to resolve the issues while ensuring an excellent client experience
  • Scheduling, collaborating and managing internal and external business partners to ensure operational excellence in Blueground properties
  • Liaising across functions within the business to identify the origin of customer support issues and improve related processes to enhance customer experience
  • Maintaining long-lasting relations with business stakeholders

What we are looking for:

  • Ability to work Friday to Tuesday PST hours
  • Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent experience
  • 3-5 years of work experience in a back office operations or customer service position
  • Great communication skills- both written and verbal
  • Able to maintain strong professional relationships with customers and business partners
  • Problem-solving attitude and efficient in multitasking

Your benefits:

  • Competitive salary
  • Flexible paid time off
  • Enhanced parental leave
  • 401k retirement plan
  • Competitive Health insurance (Medical, Dental and Vision), along with complimentary access to OneMedical and Health Advocate
  • Flexible work environment through our Blueground Nomads employee mobility program
  • Dynamic working environment with talented people
  • Complimentary accommodation in Blueground locations. Think summer in Greece and winter in Dubai!

At Blueground we are proud to have Diversity and Inclusion at the centre of everything we do. We are committed to Equal Employment Opportunity regardless of race, colour, national origin, ethnicity, gender, age, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or religion.

title: Guest Operations Specialist - Austin
description:
At Blueground, we are guided by a vision to make people feel at home wherever they choose to live. By offering fully-furnished apartments that are move-in ready in the world’s most vibrant neighborhoods, we provide our guests with the opportunity to simply #ShowUpStartLiving. Behind the scenes, we strive for a tech-powered living experience that guests love, homed in an organization where great people are proud to work.

We’ve grown a lot since our founding in 2013. We are now hosting guests in more than 4,000 homes in 15 cities. We have raised more than $100m+ in funding to date and that’s just the beginning.

What drives our success is how each of our team members applies our core values. To our team, Time is everything, and we cherish it greatly. For us, Excellence isn’t simply a standard, but an exciting way to look at life. We Care deeply about our clients and colleagues and never lose sight of the human element, which goes hand-in-hand with Transparency which we believe makes our day-to-day life easier.

We are looking for a Guest Operations Specialist to join our fast growing Austin team. The ideal candidate should be a stickler for detail, proactive, skilled in general maintenance tasks and thoughtful as to ensure that the property is continuously in pristine condition for our guests. The role is primarily responsible for assisting our Operations Team in preparing new units, ensuring that existing units are perfect for our guests, and handling any issues or emergencies that arise. These issues include but are not limited to handling guest lockouts, emergency relocations, as well as keeping Operations Managers informed of potential repairs and actions being taken.

What you’ll focus on:

  • Work with our team of Operations Managers to ensure our properties are fully-equipped and move-in ready for our guests.
  • "Be Blueground's "boots on the ground" to help resolve issues impacting our guests such as handling guest concerns, requests, maintenance matters/repairs and technology issues (e.g., supervising handyman/locksmith/plumber, managing deliveries, handling building maintenance/follow-up, resolving WIFI/TV issues, etc.)
  • Perform unit check-in & check-outs before and after every guest stay to ensure each apartment meets business + guest quality standards
  • Carry out Blueground homes walkthroughs to ensure all quality assurance criteria are met when it comes to post maintenance/service requests, interiors/furnishing specifications, and overall design and aesthetics
  • Showcase your knack for custom-centricity by being the main point of contact between our guests and the Customer Experience team
  • Balance workflow processes with independent on-the-go work most of the time, and desk-based tasks (e.g., email, slack, G-suite) the rest of the time

What we’re looking for:

  • Problem solver, with ability to work in a fast-paced and "get the job done" culture
  • Enthusiasm to own a part in driving operational excellence
  • Detail-oriented
  • Confident user of technology (email, slack, G suite)
  • Access to a reliable vehicle & driver’s license for roles based in certain markets (e.g., SF/Bay Area, Seattle, Los Angeles) with reimbursement for mileage
  • A positive, driven, upbeat and friendly personality

Your benefits:

  • Be part of a fast-growing global startup that’s shaping the future of renting & living around the world
  • Competitive salary
  • Flexible paid time off
  • Enhanced parental leave
  • 401k retirement plan
  • Corporate cell phone plan
  • Competitive Health insurance (Medical, Dental and Vision), along with complimentary access to OneMedical and Health Advocate
  • Complimentary accommodation in Blueground locations. Think summer in Greece and winter in Dubai!

At Blueground we are proud to have Diversity and Inclusion at the centre of everything we do. We are committed to Equal Employment Opportunity regardless of race, color, national origin, ethnicity, gender, age, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or religion.

The ideal candidate should be a stickler for detail, proactive, skilled in maintenance tasks and thoughtful as to ensure that the property is continuously in pristine condition for our guests. The role is primarily responsible for assisting our Operations Team in preparing new units, ensuring that existing units are perfect for our guests, and handling any issues or emergencies that arise. These issues include but are not limited to: guest lockouts, emergency relocations and communication to keep Operations Managers informed of potential repairs and actions being taken.

This position will require weekend and evening shifts but will not exceed a total of 40 hours/week.

What you will mostly focus on:

  • Complete maintenance tasks to ensure positive guest experience such as repairs of furniture (broken bed frames, loose legs on tables and chairs)
  • Complete maintenance task such us plumbing, electrical, windows fixing etc
  • Assist in delivering missing items to clients, such as glassware, lighting, small appliances, etc.
  • Supervise outsourced technicians while working on resolving an emergency in our apartments (locksmith, plumber etc.)

What you may focus on:

  • Perform messenger related duties such as collecting paperwork, delivering items, receiving mail
  • Deliver keys to front desks, or placing lockboxes for client arrivals

What we are looking for:

  • Willingness to get your hands dirty as needed to achieve operational excellence
  • Great at handy work
  • Must be comfortable using tools such as drills, hammers, mounting
  • Can perform heavy lifting when needed
  • Is flexible and available to work weekends and or evenings
  • Problem solver, with ability to work in a fast-paced and "get the job done" culture
  • Hard working with great attention to detail
  • Ability to multitask and remain calm under pressure
  • Confident user of technology (email, slack, G suite)
  • A positive, upbeat and friendly personality

Your benefits:

  • Competitive salary
  • Private life and health insurance plan
  • Dynamic working environment with talented people
  • Complimentary accommodation in Blueground locations. Think summer in Greece and winter in Dubai!

We are looking to recruit a Quality Assurance Associate based in Athens to work with our Client Experience and Operations teams. The role will focus on ensuring that Blueground properties are according to company brand and quality standards.

What you will focus on:

  • Facilitate our non-conformities / operational wastes monitoring tool and analyze the issues reported there

  • Check and evaluate the cleaning services conducted in our properties by cleaning partners
  • Prepare regular reports including the inspection findings
  • Conduct data accuracy audits
  • Lead the implementation of the entire quality audit plan based on quality assurance principles

What we are looking for:

  • Attention to detail

We are looking for a creative, organized, flexible and self-motivated Strategic Partnerships Executive who thrives on closing deals and working independently to join our Global Partnerships department.

As the first dedicated hire for a growing global team, you’ll have the opportunity to shape the direction of future initiatives. This high-profile position reports directly to our Co-founder & Director of Partnerships.

The ideal candidate has a mix of professional experience with consumer and/or startup brands, a love of negotiation, and an entrepreneurial mindset. You’ll be creating and cultivating relationships with exciting F&B, transportation, technology, and health & fitness brands while working on some of Blueground’s most creative, fun and high-impact projects. Also you will be expected to take initiative, make suggestions and fully own your projects from start to finish.

Your goal will be to elevate the stay -- and even transform the lives of -- thousands of Blueground guests, while enhancing our brand appeal and generating additional revenue for the company.

You can choose to work from one of our 15 global offices or be completely remote.

What will you focus on :

  • Co-manage the implementation and maintenance of a high-value revenue stream that will contribute millions of dollars per year to Blueground
  • Identify and establish new, high-impact strategic partners that will elevate the stay of Blueground guests and enhance the brand value of the company by association
  • Manage existing partner relationships, while working towards maximizing their potential
  • Work closely with the marketing team, including PR, Brand and Social Media, to implement new communication touchpoints, while managing and optimizing existing ones
  • Work closely with Sales, Operations and Client Experience to identify company and guest needs that can be covered through partnerships
  • Conduct frequent partner performance analysis and evaluation

What we are looking for:

  • Degree from a top–tier university
  • 2+ years of work experience
  • Flexibility and ability to work independently
  • Strong organizational skills, with the ability to balance competing priorities
  • Effective and persuasive communicator, both written and verbal
  • Interest in negotiating deals
  • Creativity

You will focus on providing valid financial management information to our Reporting & Cost Control manager in order to facilitate decision support, resulting in growth of revenues and profitability.

What you will focus on:

  • Collate and analyze monthly financial and performance metrics for revenue and direct costs in the pursuit of improving the cash flow and operations efficiency of your assigned cities

  • Support the senior management with ad hoc financial analysis and reporting projects as required
  • Understand and report, cost variances between actual, budget, forecast

What we are looking for:

  • Bachelor’s degree in the fields of Finance/Economics/Business Administration from a top-tier university
  • A MSc degree in the related fields will be considered as a plus
  • 3-5 years of relevant experience preferably in a multinational company (previous start up experience will be considered as a plus)
  • Fluency in both English and Greek
  • Strong fluency with MS Office and specifically Excel
  • Solid analytical, organizational, planning and problem-solving skills
  • Good communicator with strong interpersonal skills

title: Senior DevOps Engineer
description:
At Blueground, we are guided by a vision to make people feel at home wherever they choose to live. By offering fully-furnished apartments that are move-in ready in the world’s most vibrant neighborhoods, we provide our guests with the opportunity to simply #ShowUpStartLiving. Behind the scenes, we strive for a tech-powered living experience that guests love, homed in an organization where great people are proud to work.

We’ve grown a lot since our founding in 2013. We are now hosting guests in more than 4,000 homes in 15 cities. We have raised more than $100m+ in funding to date and that’s just the beginning.

What drives our success is how each of our team members applies our core values. To our team, Time is everything, and we cherish it greatly. For us, Excellence isn’t simply a standard, but an exciting way to look at life. We Care deeply about our clients and colleagues and never lose sight of the human element, which goes hand-in-hand with Transparency which we believe makes our day-to-day easier.

We are looking for a talented Senior DevOps Engineer to join our Engineering team and play a pivotal role in our effort to deliver better software faster.

You'll be a core member of our platform team which is a DevOps / SDET hybrid that is responsible for CI/CD, infrastructure, testing and telemetry. You are going to wear many hats, call it platform, security, testing, cloud or automation engineering, and mostly work on AWS. We like to reliably automate tasks, we’re infrastructure as code enthusiasts and understand the importance of having good production telemetry to solve any issues as they occur.


What you'll do

  • Architect and manage our cloud infrastructure
  • Work on low-risk releases and zero-downtime deployments
  • Build continuous integration pipelines
  • Build production telemetry
  • Consult teams regarding testing
  • Build and audit infra and product security
  • Automate or oversee the automation of tasks
  • Take on-call shifts
  • Do all of the above using a DevOps mindset

Our tech-stack is mostly based on:

  • Kotlin, Python, Node.js, Groovy, Bash
  • PostgresDB, MongoDB, Redis
  • RESTful, GraphQL APIs
  • Kafka, RabbitMQ
  • Linux, Docker, k8s, EKS
  • Chef, Ansible, Packer
  • CloudFormation, Terraform
  • Jenkins CI, ArgoCD

What to expect

  • To work in agile, cross-functional, DevOps enabled :) teams
  • To work closely with developers
  • To build lots of stuff from scratch
  • Your opinion to matter
  • To get your hands on latest goodies - we’re open-minded geeks
  • To enjoy some quality engineering
  • A rapidly growing company
  • Cool colleagues :)

Interview process

  • Initial call with People Team
  • Coding assignment (3 working days) or Live coding interview (2h)
  • Technical Interview (2h)
  • Interview with an engineering manager (1h)

What to expect at the technical interview?

You will be called to have a long discussion with your future team members. This discussion will cover many aspects such as a brief summary of your background, your CS foundations, a broad range of questions regarding different technologies, OSs, Systems, Networking, Databases, etc. We will also try to tackle some real-world software design problems together and finally solve some algorithmic problems around topics such as string manipulation, search, arrays etc. Relax and remember that this is not an interview to check on your geekiness level but to see if we can work together as a team.

A few things this team has delivered so far

  • Ported evolving infra to code (Cloudformation/Terraform)
  • Delivered a zero downtime database migration
  • Moved infrastructure from standalone EC2s to OpsWorks
  • Moved infrastructure from OpsWorks to K8S
  • Designed a CI/CD testing/release process
  • Implemented a performant, cost-effective CI pipeline on Jenkins as code
  • Prototyped all test suites across layers and services (API / UI / Lambdas / etc)
  • Delivered anonymised data provisioning through Kafka CDC
  • Had a great time all the way through


What we are looking for:

  • 3+ years managing production systems on the cloud
  • Strong background in Linux administration
  • Strong skills in at least one of Python, Ruby, Javascript
  • Good experience with one of Puppet, Chef, Ansible, Salt
  • Experience with infrastructure & app performance monitoring tools
  • Really comfortable with Git
  • Excellent communication in English
  • BS/MS degree in Computer Science or a related subject
  • Bonus: experience with CloudFormation, Terraform or other IaC tool
  • Bonus: having used a time-series database in production

Your Benefits:

  • Competitive salary
  • Ticket Restaurant Card
  • Group Health Insurance program
  • Mobile Data Plan
  • Workstation of your choice
  • Access to training budget and resources (safaribooksonline, frontendmasters, raywenderlich et al)
  • Flexible paid time off
  • Enhanced parental leave
  • Complimentary accommodation in Blueground locations. Think summer in LA and winter in Dubai!
  • Dynamic working environment with talented people
  • Being part of a working culture which embraces autonomy and initiative taking
  • Flexible work environment through our Blueground Nomads employee mobility program

By contributing to the overall efficient operation of the department and by helping the company be fully aware of its financial condition, this role can help the company make the right decisions and accomplish long-term success. The ideal candidate should be able to work comfortably with numbers and have great attention to detail.

What you will focus on:

  • Post and process journal entries to ensure all business transactions are recorded
  • Update accounts payable, A/P master data, and perform reconciliations
  • Update accounts receivable, A/R master data, and perform reconciliations
  • Ensure proper application of controls in A/P and A/R processes
  • Assist in the monthly/annual preparation of the balance sheet, income statement and other financial reports according to IFRS and internal accounting guidelines

title: Teknisyen
description:
Blueground olarak, kişilerin yaşamayı seçtikleri her yerde kendilerini evlerinde hissetmelerini sağlamak vizyonuyla hareket ediyoruz. Dünyanın en gözde lokasyonlarında, taşınmaya hazır tam donanımlı daireler sunarak müşterilerimize #ShowUpStartLiving fırsatı sağlıyoruz.
Arka planda, harika bir ekibin çalışmaktan mutlu olduğu bir organizasyon ile, misafirlerimizin sevdiği teknoloji destekli bir yaşam deneyimi için çalışıyoruz.Kurulduğumuz 2013 yılından bu yana aldığımız yatırımlarla 12 şehirde 4000+ eve ulaştık. Bu süreçte aldığımız 100+ milyon dolarlık yatırım, yalnızca başlangıç. Bu başarının sırrı, ekip üyelerimizin her birinin temel değerlerimize uygunluğudur.
Ekibimiz için ‘zaman’ her şeydir ve bunun kıymetini biliyoruz.
‘Mükemmellik’ sadece bir standart değil, hayata bakmanın heyecan verici bir yoludur.
Müşterilerimize ve ekip üyelerimize derinden ‘değer’ veriyoruz ve insan odağını kaybetmeden bunu ‘şeffaflık’ ilkemiz ile bağdaştırarak hayatlarımızı günden güne kolaylaştırıyoruz.


------

İş Tanımı

Blueground bünyesinde bulunan gayrimenkullerin bakım ve onarım işlerinin (elektrik, tesisat, iklimlendirme sistemleri vb) gerçekleştirmesi

Bina ortak alan ve merkezi sistem ile alakalı işlerde bina tekniği yada görevli ile iletişim halinde bulunarak sorunların çözümlenmesi ve takip edilmesi

Müşteri hizmetleri ve kalite kontrol ekibi ile sürekli iletişim halinde olunması, dairelerin belirlenen standartlara uygun hale getirilmesi konusunda eşyalandırma ekibine destek verilmesi

Belirli dönemlerde gayrimenkul demirbaş ve durum envanterlerin kontrolü ve güncellemesi,

Yedek malzeme ve sarf malzeme ile ilgili ihtiyaçların düzenli olarak depo sorumlusuna bildirilmesi ve takip edilmesi görevlerini yerine getirebilecek takım arkadaşları arıyoruz.
requirements:
Aranan Nitelikler

- Meslek Lisesi veya Meslek Yüksek Okulu mezunu; Elektik/Elektronik, Mekatronik ve benzeri bölümlerden mezun, mesleki yeterlilik belgelerine sahip

- İleri düzeyde elektrik-elektronik bilgisi olan, bina bakım, onarım ve tesisat işlerinde tecrübeli

- Minimum 5 yıl hizmet sektöründe deneyimi olan,

- B sınıfı ehliyeti olan, aktif olarak araç kullanabilen

- Haftada 6 gün sahada olabilecek, dinamik çalışma ortamlarına ve esnek çalışma saatlerine uyum sağlayabilecek

- Levent merkez olmak üzere, İstanbul’un iki yakasında da günlük atanan görevleri yerine getirebilecek

- Teknolojiye meraklı, gelişime açık, öğrenmeyi ve araştırmayı alışkanlık haline getirmiş, bilgisayar kullanabilen, dikkatli, titiz çalışan, teknik el becerisine güvenen,

- Müşteri memnuniyetini temel ilke olarak benimsemiş,

- Dış görünümüne ve kişisel bakımına özen gösteren,

- Tercihen başlangıç ve orta seviye İngilizce bilgisi olan,

- Erkek adaylar için askerlik hizmetini tamamlamış ekip arkadaşları arıyoruz.

title: Guest Operations Specialist - Denver
description:
At Blueground, we are guided by a vision to make people feel at home wherever they choose to live. By offering fully-furnished apartments that are move-in ready in the world’s most vibrant neighborhoods, we provide our guests with the opportunity to simply #ShowUpStartLiving. Behind the scenes, we strive for a tech-powered living experience that guests love, homed in an organization where great people are proud to work.

We’ve grown a lot since our founding in 2013. We are now hosting guests in more than 4,000 homes in 15 cities. We have raised more than $100m+ in funding to date and that’s just the beginning.

What drives our success is how each of our team members applies our core values. To our team, Time is everything, and we cherish it greatly. For us, Excellence isn’t simply a standard, but an exciting way to look at life. We Care deeply about our clients and colleagues and never lose sight of the human element, which goes hand-in-hand with Transparency which we believe makes our day-to-day life easier.

We are looking for a Guest Operations Specialist to join our fast growing Denver team. The ideal candidate should be a stickler for detail, proactive, skilled in general maintenance tasks and thoughtful as to ensure that the property is continuously in pristine condition for our guests. The role is primarily responsible for assisting our Operations Team in preparing new units, ensuring that existing units are perfect for our guests, and handling any issues or emergencies that arise. These issues include but are not limited to handling guest lockouts, emergency relocations, as well as keeping Operations Managers informed of potential repairs and actions being taken.

What you’ll focus on:

  • Work with our team of Operations Managers to ensure our properties are fully-equipped and move-in ready for our guests.
  • "Be Blueground's "boots on the ground" to help resolve issues impacting our guests such as handling guest concerns, requests, maintenance matters/repairs and technology issues (e.g., supervising handyman/locksmith/plumber, managing deliveries, handling building maintenance/follow-up, resolving WIFI/TV issues, etc.)
  • Perform unit check-in & check-outs before and after every guest stay to ensure each apartment meets business + guest quality standards
  • Carry out Blueground homes walkthroughs to ensure all quality assurance criteria are met when it comes to post maintenance/service requests, interiors/furnishing specifications, and overall design and aesthetics
  • Showcase your knack for custom-centricity by being the main point of contact between our guests and the Customer Experience team
  • Balance workflow processes with independent on-the-go work most of the time, and desk-based tasks (e.g., email, slack, G-suite) the rest of the time

What we’re looking for:

  • Problem solver, with ability to work in a fast-paced and "get the job done" culture
  • Enthusiasm to own a part in driving operational excellence
  • Detail-oriented
  • Confident user of technology (email, slack, G suite)
  • Access to a reliable vehicle & driver’s license for roles based in certain markets (e.g., SF/Bay Area, Seattle, Los Angeles) with reimbursement for mileage
  • A positive, driven, upbeat and friendly personality

Your benefits:

  • Be part of a fast-growing global startup that’s shaping the future of renting & living around the world
  • Competitive salary
  • Flexible paid time off
  • Enhanced parental leave
  • 401k retirement plan
  • Corporate cell phone plan
  • Competitive Health insurance (Medical, Dental and Vision), along with complimentary access to OneMedical and Health Advocate
  • Complimentary accommodation in Blueground locations. Think summer in Greece and winter in Dubai!

At Blueground we are proud to have Diversity and Inclusion at the centre of everything we do. We are committed to Equal Employment Opportunity regardless of race, color, national origin, ethnicity, gender, age, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or religion.

We are looking for a General Manager for our imminent launch in the city of Madrid.

The GM position is one of the most exciting and impactful roles at Blueground. As the leader of Madrid office and a member of Blueground’s global leadership team, you will own your P&L and manage all business activities: from hiring your team, to on-boarding and marketing units, to building strong relationships with the local real estate industry. You will be responsible for launching, scaling and owning the Madrid market. If you like ownership, leadership and hustling, while being very strategic and analytical in your approach, this is the right role for you.

What you will focus on:

  • Owning the P&L for Blueground's Madrid's business
  • Building and scaling a best-in-class team for real estate, operations and sales
  • Defining city priorities and goals, and managing performance on a monthly and quarterly basis by setting relevant KPIs and incentive structure
  • Identifying unexplored opportunities and adapting the business model to local requirements, taking into account potential regulatory constraints
  • Staying actively educated on Madrid's real estate trends to adapt and refine leasing strategy
  • Shaping and sharing best practices with the rest of the network towards the constant efficiency improvement of our global operations.
  • Being the face of Blueground in Madrid - local PR and networking events
  • Collaborating with Product, Revenue Management, Marketing, Technology and Client Experience teams to meet the needs of local market

What we are looking for:

  • Relevant experience (at least 5 years) in leadership roles and ideally managing own P&L and building a high-performing team
  • Excellent communication in English both verbally and in writing
  • Entrepreneurial drive, adaptability, and focus on results
  • Ability to work independently, effectively and efficiently
  • Demonstrated ability to lead complex operational and strategic initiatives
  • Analytical and data-driven decision making
  • A team player that will fit with our values and add to our culture

Your benefits:

  • Competitive salary
  • Discretionary annual bonus scheme
  • Stock options plan
  • Flexible paid time off

  • Dynamic working environment with talented people
  • Complimentary accommodation in Blueground locations. Think summer in LA and winter in Dubai

Your benefits:

title: Maintenance Technician - Τεχνικός Συντήρησης
description:
Τεχνικός συντήρησης

Το όραμα της Blueground είναι να επιτρέψει σε όλους τους ανθρώπους να νιώθουν σαν στο σπίτι τους, όπου κι αν επιλέγουν να ζήσουν. Πετυχαίνουμε αυτό το στόχο μας προσφέροντας πλήρως επιπλωμένα και έτοιμα για διαμονή διαμερίσματα στις πιο δημοφιλείς γειτονιές του κόσμου για μηνιαία ενοικίαση. Δημιουργούμε για τους πελάτες μας μια εμπειρία διαβίωσης που υποστηρίζεται από την τεχνολογία και μας επιτρέπει να κάνουμε τη δουλειά μας πιο εύκολη και γρήγορη.

Η εταιρεία μας ιδρύθηκε το 2013 και πλέον διαθέτει πάνω από 4.000 διαμερίσματα σε 14 πόλεις και 7 χώρες. Έχουμε συγκεντρώσει πάνω από € 100 εκατομμύρια χρηματοδότηση από τους επενδυτές μας μέχρι σήμερα και αυτή είναι μόνο η αρχή!

Αυτό που καθοδηγεί την επιτυχία μας είναι πώς κάθε μέλος της ομάδας μας ενσαρκώνει τις βασικές μας Αρχές. Στη Blueground έχουμε τέσσερις βασικές Αρχές. Αυτές είναι η εξοικονόμηση Χρόνου για τους πελάτες μας και στον τρόπο που δουλεύουμε, η αφοσίωση στην Τελειότητα, που δεν είναι απλώς μια λέξη αλλά ένας συναρπαστικός τρόπος ζωής, το Ενδιαφέρον για τους πελάτες και τους συναδέλφους μας και τέλος η Διαφάνεια που διέπει όλες μας τις συναλλαγές και κάνει την καθημερινότητά μας ευκολότερη.

Αυτή την περίοδο, αναζητούμε έναν Τεχνικό συντήρησης με γνώση στους ελαιοχρωματισμούς για να ενταχθεί στην ομάδα της Αθήνας. Θα είναι υπεύθυνος για την αποκατάσταση τεχνικών βλαβών και το βάψιμο των διαμερισμάτων μας.


Κύριες αρμοδιότητες:

  • Εφαρμογή διαφόρων φινιρισμάτων σε κτίρια και δωμάτια, συμπεριλαμβάνοντας αστάρι ή λοιπά στεγανοποιητικά
  • Προετοιμασία, καθαρισμός και προστασία με ειδικές ταινίες στα διαμερίσματά μας
  • Αφαίρεση της παλιάς επίστρωσης μπογιάς, εάν κριθεί απαραίτητο
  • Ανάμειξη χρωμάτων για να καταλήξουμε στο επιθυμητό χρώμα
  • Συνεισφορά σε άλλες εργασίες συντήρησης όπως εγκατάσταση φωτιστικών οροφής, υδραυλικές εργασίες, συντήρηση κλιματιστικών μονάδων, τοπικές επισκευές επίπλων, γυάλισμα επίπλων, κλπ


Τι ψάχνουμε:

  • Υπευθυνότητα και συνέπεια
  • Αποδεδειγμένη εργασιακή εμπειρία ως ελαιοχρωματιστής
  • Οργάνωση και μεθοδικότητα στον τρόπο εργασίας
  • Ικανότητα καλής επικοινωνίας και συνεργασίας τόσο με τους πελάτες όσο με τους συναδέλφους του και τα υπόλοιπα συνεργεία
  • Δυνατότητα ασφαλούς διαχείρισης εξοπλισμού
  • Σε βάθος γνώση των τεχνικών χρωματισμού εμπορικών ή/και κατασκευαστικών εγκαταστάσεων
  • Γνώση του τρόπου χρήσης των κατάλληλων εργαλείων (βούρτσες, πιστόλια στεγανοποίησης κτλ.)
  • Χειρωνακτική επιδεξιότητα και άριστη ισορροπία κατά την εργασία σε σκάλες κτλ.
  • Ευσυνειδησία και μεγάλη προσοχή στη λεπτομέρεια


Τί προσφέρουμε:

  • Ανταγωνιστικό μισθολογικό πακέτο και μπόνους αποδοτικότητας
  • Δυναμικό περιβάλλον εργασίας με ταλαντούχους επαγγελματίες
  • Ευέλικτη άδεια μετ 'αποδοχών
  • Πρόγραμμα ομαδικής ιατροφαρμακευτικής περίθαλψης
  • Δωρεάν διαμονή σε διαμερίσματα της Blueground στο εξωτερικό

title: Sales Associate
description:
At Blueground, we are guided by a vision to make people feel at home wherever they choose to live. By offering fully-furnished apartments that are move-in ready in the world’s most vibrant neighborhoods, we provide our guests with the opportunity to simply #ShowUpStartLiving. Behind the scenes, we strive for a tech-powered living experience that guests love, homed in an organization where great people are proud to work.

We’ve grown a lot since our founding in 2013. We are now hosting guests in more than 4,200 homes in 15 cities. We have raised more than $100m in funding to date and that’s just the beginning. But enough of the numbers.

What drives our success is how each of our team members applies our core values. To our team, Time is everything, and we cherish it greatly. For us, Excellence isn’t simply a standard, but an exciting way to look at life. We Care deeply about our clients and colleagues and never lose sight of the human element, which goes hand-in-hand with Transparency which we believe makes our day-to-day easier.

We are looking to recruit a Sales Associate based in Athens to join our centralized Inbound Sales department and be responsible for our Athens Sales Operations. As member of our sales team you will manage inbound sales requests concerning bookings of Blueground properties.

What you will focus on:

  • Respond to incoming property sales inquiries full cycle and handling requests (via phone, email, social tools etc) generated from all online sales channels offering clients the best accommodation solution based on their need
  • Forecast sales activity and revenue (meeting and exceeding weekly, quarterly, and annual sales quotas and KPIs)
  • Proactive daily pipeline management in our CRM

What we are looking for:

  • 1-3 years experience in sales or account management in the real estate sector in a quota carrying role
  • Ability to run proper exploratory/discovery calls, be an active listener and objection handling and negotiation
  • Customer first mindset and hunter mentality
  • Coachable individual able to implement feedback
  • Ability to multitask in a fast paced environment
  • Native Greek and fluent English speaker

Your benefits:

  • Competitive salary
  • Flexible paid time off
  • Group Health Insurance program
  • Enhanced parental leave
  • Dynamic working environment with talented people
  • Flexible work environment through our Blueground Nomads employee mobility program
  • Complimentary accommodation in Blueground locations. Think summer in LA and winter in Dubai!

At Blueground we are proud to have Diversity and Inclusion at the centre of everything we do. We are committed to Equal Employment Opportunity regardless of race, colour, national origin, ethnicity, gender, age, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or religion.

title: Software Engineer, Front End
description:
At Blueground, we are guided by a vision to make people feel at home wherever they choose to live. By offering fully-furnished apartments that are move-in ready in the world’s most vibrant neighborhoods, we provide our guests with the opportunity to simply #ShowUpStartLiving. Behind the scenes, we strive for a tech-powered living experience that guests love, homed in an organization where great people are proud to work.

We’ve grown a lot since our founding in 2013. We are now hosting guests in more than 4,000 homes in 15 cities. We have raised more than $100m+ in funding to date and that’s just the beginning.

What drives our success is how each of our team members applies our core values. To our team, Time is everything, and we cherish it greatly. For us, Excellence isn’t simply a standard, but an exciting way to look at life. We Care deeply about our clients and colleagues and never lose sight of the human element, which goes hand-in-hand with Transparency which we believe makes our day-to-day easier.

We are looking for a talented Front End Engineer to join our Engineering team in Athens and our mission to offer a world class experience to our customers on the web, office based or remote.

We are a tech enabled company, currently making substantial investments in our technology platform, from our booking website and mobile app to our key business internal software, to enable our next stage of high growth.The person in this role will work on our web products with some of the latest tech goodies, solid engineering practices and demanding requirements on UX, analytics and performance.


Our Stack

  • ES2015+
  • Node.js | Express | Koa
  • MongoDB | Postgres | Redis
  • RabbitMQ
  • Vue.js | Angular | Vanilla.js
  • Jest | WebDriver.io | Cypress.io
  • RESTful APIs | gRPC
  • Serverless
  • GraphQL on Prisma up next

Our code sits on Github, is integrated through Jenkins pipelines and runs on AWS EKS & Lambda. We do project management on JIRA, our prototypes and mockups on Figma and monitor our systems and performance on Datadog and New Relic.


What you'll focus on

  • Architect, design and build product features on Blueground’s web products
  • Deliver rich, responsive, mobile first experiences on the browser
  • Participate in SCRUM ceremonies
  • Code in Vue.js
  • Write your unit tests
  • Write your e2e tests
  • Sometimes write your HTML & CSS
  • Automate stuff
  • Depend on a CI pipeline
  • Experiment and create rapid prototypes


What to expect

  • Your opinion to matter
  • To work in an agile, cross functional, devops enabled team
  • To work with a product designer, a product manager and an engineer in test
  • To work on functional and non functional testing
  • To build lots of stuff from scratch and rewrite quite as many
  • To work on performance and SEO
  • To move beyond frameworks and take advantage of modern browser tech
  • To enjoy some quality engineering
  • To get your hands on latest goodies - we’re open-minded geeks
  • A rapidly growing company
  • Cool colleagues :)


Interview process

  • Video call dialogue with People Team
  • Introductory video call dialogue with one of our senior engineers
  • Coding assignment (3+ working days)
  • Technical Interview, 2+ hours long
  • Interview with Head of engineering

What to expect at the technical interview?

You will be called to have a long discussion with your future team members. This discussion will cover many things from CS fundamentals to latest web and Javascript tech. So we encourage you to do a quick refresh on topics like data structures, algos and runtime complexity as well as core Javascript and web fundamentals. We will also try to tackle some real-world software design problems together as we do every other day. It may sound scary but it's really not. We want you to succeed.
requirements:
• 2+ years of full-time industry experience working with web technologies
  • Strong web fundamentals and solid understanding of the 2020's web ecosystem
  • Strong Javascript skills (ES2015+)
  • Strong HTML & CSS skills
  • An eye for good UX
  • Core Web APIs like DOM, Storage, Fetch etc should not be strange to you
  • Really comfortable with Git
  • Excellent communication in English
  • BS/MS degree in Computer Science or a related subject
  • Bonus: experience doing fullstack development on Node.js
  • Bonus: knowing your way around *nix shell
  • Bonus: experience in software testing

description:

We are a tech enabled company, currently making substantial investments in our technology platform, from our booking website and mobile app to our key business internal software, to enable our next stage of high growth.The person in this role will work on our backend services with a well established development methodology, a robust CI pipeline, solid engineering practices and challenging requirements (you won't get bored).


Our Stack

  • Kotlin | Javascript | Typescript
  • Spring Boot
  • Node
  • Postgres | MongoDB | Redis
  • RabbitMq
  • Spock | Jest | Cypress.io
  • Rest | GraphQL
  • Docker | AWS | k8s on EKS
  • Serverless

Our code sits on Github, is integrated through Jenkins pipelines and runs on AWS EKS & Lambda. We do project management on JIRA, our prototypes and mockups on Figma and monitor our systems and performance on Datadog and New Relic.


What you'll do

  • Architect, design and build our internal platform and tools
  • Participate in SCRUM ceremonies
  • Code services and APIs
  • Write your unit tests
  • Write your e2e tests (functional & performance)
  • Automate stuff. Like a lot.
  • Be religious with Git
  • Depend on a CI pipeline
  • Experiment, learn and have fun


What to expect

  • To work in agile, cross functional, DevOps enabled teams
  • To work with a product manager and an engineer in test
  • To work on functional and non functional testing
  • To work on performance
  • To get your head around a quite big problem domain
  • To solve hard problems
  • To enjoy some quality engineering
  • A rapidly growing company
  • Opportunities to do full stack or go polyglot if interested (e.g. Python or Go)
  • Cool colleagues :)


Interview process

  • Video call dialogue with People Team
  • Introductory video call dialogue with one of our senior engineers
  • Coding assignment (3+ working days)
  • Technical Interview, 2+ hours long
  • Interview with Head of engineering

What to expect at the technical interview?

You will be called to have a long discussion with your future team members. This discussion will cover many things from CS fundamentals to latest coding trends. So we encourage you to do a quick refresh on topics like data structures, algos and runtime complexity as well as core concepts of your primary language (e.g. Java or Python). We will also try to tackle some real-world software design problems together as we do every other day. It may sound scary but it's really not. We want you to succeed.
requirements:
• Industry experience in software development
  • Strong CS background
  • Strong skills in one of Kotlin, Java, Python, Ruby, Javascript
  • Strong background in relational databases and SQL
  • Good knowledge of the Spring framework & the JEE platform is a plus
  • Experience in designing REST APIs
  • Testing mindset and an eye for clean code
  • Really comfortable with Git
  • Excellent communication in English
  • BS/MS degree in Computer Science or a related subject
  • Bonus: experience with other JVM languages like Groovy or Kotlin
  • Bonus: knowing your way around the *nix shell
  • Bonus: experience with NoSQL storage (Redis, Elastic, MongoDB)
  • Bonus: experience with binary APIs (Protocol Buffers, Avro etc)

We are looking for a Guest Operations Specialist to join our fast growing Los Angeles team. The ideal candidate should be a stickler for detail, proactive, skilled in general maintenance tasks and thoughtful as to ensure that the property is continuously in pristine condition for our guests. The role is primarily responsible for assisting our Operations Team in preparing new units, ensuring that existing units are perfect for our guests, and handling any issues or emergencies that arise. These issues include but are not limited to handling guest lockouts, emergency relocations, as well as keeping Operations Managers informed of potential repairs and actions being taken.

This position will require some weekend and evening shifts but will not exceed a total of 40 hours/week.

This position requires a reliable method of transportation, as it involves commuting to and from various properties.

What you’ll focus on:

  • Work with our team of Operations Managers to ensure our properties are fully-equipped and move-in ready for our guests.
  • "Be Blueground's "boots on the ground" to help resolve issues impacting our guests such as handling guest concerns, requests, maintenance matters/repairs and technology issues (e.g., supervising handyman/locksmith/plumber, managing deliveries, handling building maintenance/follow-up, resolving WIFI/TV issues, etc.)
  • Perform unit check-in & check-outs before and after every guest stay to ensure each apartment meets business + guest quality standards
  • Carry out Blueground homes walkthroughs to ensure all quality assurance criteria are met when it comes to post maintenance/service requests, interiors/furnishing specifications, and overall design and aesthetics
  • Showcase your knack for custom-centricity by being the main point of contact between our guests and the Customer Experience team
  • Balance workflow processes with independent on-the-go work most of the time, and desk-based tasks (e.g., email, slack, G-suite) the rest of the time

What we’re looking for:

  • Problem solver, with ability to work in a fast-paced and "get the job done" culture
  • Enthusiasm to own a part in driving operational excellence
  • Detail-oriented
  • Confident user of technology (email, slack, G suite)
  • Access to a reliable vehicle & driver’s license for roles based in certain markets (e.g., SF/Bay Area, Seattle, Los Angeles) with reimbursement for mileage
  • A positive, driven, upbeat and friendly personality

Your benefits:

  • Competitive salary
  • Flexible paid time off
  • Enhanced parental leave
  • 401k retirement plan
  • Competitive Health insurance (Medical, Dental and Vision), along with complimentary access to OneMedical and Health Advocate

description:
At Blueground, we are guided by a vision to make people feel at home wherever they choose to live. By offering fully-furnished apartments that are move-in ready in the world’s most vibrant neighborhoods, we provide our guests with the opportunity to simply #ShowUpStartLiving. Behind the scenes, we strive for a tech-powered living experience that guests love, homed in an organization where great people are proud to work.

We’ve grown a lot since our founding in 2013. We are now hosting guests in more than 4,000 homes in 15 cities. We have raised more than $100m+ in funding to date and that’s just the beginning.

What drives our success is how each of our team members exemplifies our core values. To our team, Time is everything, and we cherish it greatly. For us, Excellence isn’t simply a standard, but an exciting way to look at life. We Care deeply about our clients and colleagues and never lose sight of the human element, which goes hand-in-hand with Transparency which we believe makes our day-to-day life easier.

We are looking for a talented Product Manager to join our growing Product Management team and support our platform product initiatives. The platform team is responsible for providing a centralized system to organize, schedule, and manage the Bluegrounders' day-to-day workflows in order to offer a delightful customer experience. The team is building the technology to:

  • Support all steps of our operational process from onboarding and furnishing a new property to publishing it to our website and other channels.
  • Streamline the end-to-end booking experience by incorporating all booking details like payments and customer requests.
  • Connect internal systems with external tools used by our teams through seamless integrations.

You will be responsible for supporting the vision, strategy, and execution of all initiatives that ensure our teams can efficiently operate and provide an amazing customer experience to our guests. This is a highly cross-functional role that is critical for the success of the company. You will be a strategic partner to department heads from several functions that define the Blueground experience, including Sales, Customer Support, Operations, Real Estate, Finance, Accounting, etc. Your goal will be to deeply understand customer needs and craft the right solutions to address them.


What you will focus on:

  • Support the definition of product vision, strategy, and metrics for the platform team.
  • Be a strategic partner to stakeholders across departments to ensure Blueground provides the best possible customer experience.
  • Develop a product roadmap and build consensus on prioritization.
  • Drive product execution, partnering with a team of world-class engineers and designers, optimally trading speed of delivery and long-term thinking.

What we are looking for:

  • Experience: 2+ years of product management experience. Experience with technical products is a plus.
  • Product Management Leadership: support the development of a product vision, planning, and execution.
  • Customer obsession: deeply understand customer needs and design solutions that delight customers.
  • Intellectual curiosity: have a deep interest about the interactions of customers with our product and dive into understanding all details of the experience.
  • Deliver results: envision the right outcome and put together a plan to achieve it.
  • Great analytical skills: define the key metrics for your product and understand the impact of a proposed business change.
  • Excellent communication: communicate complicated concepts in simple terms. Our business is international so English fluency is a must.

What to expect:

  • Agile, cross-functional, DevOps enabled teams
  • An environment that continually raises its standards of work
  • A rapidly growing company with top talent
  • Trust and autonomy
  • A learn and have fun mentality

Your benefits:

  • Competitive salary
  • Flexible paid time off
  • Group Health Insurance program
  • Enhanced parental leave
  • Dynamic working environment with talented people
  • Complimentary accommodation in Blueground locations. Think summer in LA and winter in Dubai!
  • Flexible work environment through our Blueground Nomads employee mobility program

At Blueground we are proud to have Diversity and Inclusion at the centre of everything we do. We are committed to Equal Employment Opportunity regardless of race, colour, national origin, ethnicity, gender, age, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or religion.

We are looking to recruit a Client Experience Coordinator based in Istanbul to join our client experience department. This role is a great opportunity for a hard-working and talented person to gain a real insight into the hospitality industry. If you're someone who possesses a genuine interest in customer service, technical teams coordination and problem-solving and you like to interact with internal and external customers across the business, then this role is for you!

What you will focus on:

  • Receiving complex inquiries from guests and then deciding the right way to resolve the issues while ensuring an excellent client experience
  • Scheduling, collaborating and managing internal and external business partners to ensure operational excellence in Blueground properties
  • Liaising across functions within the business to identify the origin of customer support issues and improve related processes to enhance customer experience
  • Maintaining long-lasting relations with business stakeholders
  • Planning the daily routes of operations associates based on the number of stops, location and type of their tasks assigned, as well as customers' needs and business priorities

What we are looking for:

  • Fluency in both Turkish & English languages (French, German or Spanish as well would be considered a plus)
  • 2+ years of customer service responsibilities experience and working experience in a position including back office operations, alternatively in managing housing construction projects
  • Willing to work regularly on weekends, while having some on-call evening shifts on weekdays
  • Computer literacy
  • Great communication skills, both written and verbal
  • Ability to maintain strong professional relationships with customers and business partners
  • Problem-solving attitude

Your benefits:

title: Senior Data Engineer
description:
At Blueground, we are guided by a vision to make people feel at home wherever they choose to live. What drives our success is how each of our team members applies our core values. To our team, Time is everything, and we cherish it greatly. For us, Excellence isn’t simply a standard, but an exciting way to look at life. We Care deeply about our clients and colleagues and never lose sight of the human element, which goes hand-in-hand with Transparency which we believe makes our day-to-day easier.

We are currently looking to recruit a Senior Data Engineer to join our high performing team BI team (remote working within Europe will be considered for this position). You will be working on solving challenging data modelling problems and preparing our data warehouse for scale. You will have the opportunity to process data and develop advanced SQL models for core areas such as marketing attribution, complex financial metrics, and market analytics. In addition, your key priority will be to upgrade our existing data warehouse to optimize data pipeline performance, stability, and scalability. This requires expertise in data warehouse architecture, data processing, data modelling, and high business acumen. Importantly, to be successful in this position, you will have prior experience setting up or redesigning a relational data warehouse. Your work will be instrumental in helping Blueground scale its reporting, pricing models, real estate analytics, and other high-impact initiatives. You’ll work in an exciting and collaborative environment, surrounded by talented and motivated colleagues.

What you will focus on:

  • Solve challenging data modelling problems requiring advanced logic and SQL skills
  • Remodel core tables and data warehouse structure following major engineering releases
  • Work with team to improve and optimize the data warehouse structure around scalability
  • Optimize query logic to improve data pipeline stability and performance
  • Handle post-processing and transformation of data to bring to digestible format
  • Deploy major code releases and maintain code guidelines
  • Develop, construct, test and maintain data architecture end to end
  • Build the company's KPIs by structuring new tables and coding new metric definitions
  • Implement ways to improve data reliability, efficiency, and quality
  • Work closely with Data Analysts and Business stakeholders to develop new features

What we are looking for:

  • 5+ years of experience in data warehouse architecture and data modelling - preferably working for a digital and fast paced company.
  • Degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or other relevant fields of studies
  • Expertise with design of RDBMS such as PostgreSQL.
  • Ability to design, implement and deliver maintainable and high quality code. Preferably with experience in Python or Scala.
  • Proficiency in data modelling, design patterns, building highly scalable and secured solutions.
  • Experience working with version control systems (Git, mercurial, etc.)
  • Experience working with orchestration tools (Airflow, Jenkins, etc.)
  • Experience with end-to-end testing of data pipelines
  • Excellent communication skills and strong business acumen

Your benefits:

  • Workstation of your choice
  • Competitive salary
  • Annual Performance Bonus
  • Group Health Insurance program
  • Mobile Data Plan
  • Flexible paid time off
  • Enhanced parental leave
  • Dynamic working environment with talented people
  • Complimentary accommodation in Blueground locations. Think summer in LA and winter in Dubai!
  • Flexible work environment through our Blueground Nomads employee mobility program

We Care deeply about our clients and colleagues and never lose sight of the human element, which goes hand-in-hand with Transparency which we believe makes our day-to-day life easier

We are currently looking for an Operations Manager to join our San Francisco, CA team.The Operations Manager position is one of the most impactful and essential roles at Blueground. As an Operations Manager, your primary focus will be the implementation, adaptation and continuous improvement of our business systems and processes in your city. You will be responsible for getting our new properties at a ready to move-in stage in a timely fashion, managing and training third-party contractors, 3pl companies and ensuring smooth operation across the team.

What you will focus on:

  • Full operational set-up and maintenance coordination of Blueground properties (furnishing, supplies, services, etc) according to brand style and guidelines
  • Work with the central design team on the implementation of large design initiatives
  • Style and manage the photoshoots of the new apartments to ensure spaces look perfect based on Blueground’s photoshoot guidelines
  • Drive down operational costs and constantly improve processes, while upholding Blueground’s quality standards
  • Liaise, manage and negotiate with contractors, vendors and external business partners ensuring that our guests enjoy high standards of client experience
  • Manage the city inventory of furniture, consumables, and linens, optimizing safety stocks and reporting furniture malfunctions to the Design and Supply Chain teams
  • Partner with cross-functional support teams in improving the efficiency and effectiveness of guest experience services
  • Manage timely data collection to update operational metrics to achieve productivity targets, reduce cost per unit, eliminate errors, and deliver excellent customer service
  • Manage the team of Operations Associates (who will assist in the set up of the apartments), by leading their onboarding process and providing continuous feedback

What we are looking for:

  • 4+ years of progressive work experience preferably in the area of business operations or services in a start-up, SME or large corporation
  • Bachelor's degree
  • Results-oriented go-getter; great at multitasking and managing competing priorities
  • Exceptional communication and organizational skills
  • Significant project management experience while working under tight deadlines
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills put to use in a fast pace environment
  • Fluent in Google Suite and MS Office; experience with inventory management systems is a plus
  • Guest-centric mindset
  • Team player and creative thinker
  • Experience in hospitality or real estate is considered a plus
  • Team management experience, optimally in field operations is considered a plus

Your benefits:

  • Competitive salary
  • Competitive Health insurance (Medical, Dental and Vision), along with complimentary access to OneMedical and Health Advocate
  • 401k retirement plan
  • Enhanced parental leave
  • Dynamic working environment with talented people
  • Complimentary accommodation in Blueground locations. Think summer in LA and winter in Dubai!

description:

For us, Excellence isn’t simply a standard, but an exciting way to look at life. We Care deeply about our clients and colleagues and never lose sight of the human element, which goes hand-in-hand with Transparency which we believe makes our day-to-day life easier.

We are looking for a Guest Operations Specialist to join our fast growing Chicago team. The ideal candidate should be a stickler for detail, proactive, skilled in general maintenance tasks and thoughtful as to ensure that the property is continuously in pristine condition for our guests. The role is primarily responsible for assisting our Operations Team in preparing new units, ensuring that existing units are perfect for our guests, and handling any issues or emergencies that arise. These issues include but are not limited to handling guest lockouts, emergency relocations, as well as keeping Operations Managers informed of potential repairs and actions being taken.

What you’ll focus on:

  • Work with our team of Operations Managers to ensure our properties are fully-equipped and move-in ready for our guests.
  • "Be Blueground's "boots on the ground" to help resolve issues impacting our guests such as handling guest concerns, requests, maintenance matters/repairs and technology issues (e.g., supervising handyman/locksmith/plumber, managing deliveries, handling building maintenance/follow-up, resolving WIFI/TV issues, etc.)
  • Perform unit check-in & check-outs before and after every guest stay to ensure each apartment meets business + guest quality standards
  • Carry out Blueground homes walkthroughs to ensure all quality assurance criteria are met when it comes to post maintenance/service requests, interiors/furnishing specifications, and overall design and aesthetics
  • Showcase your knack for custom-centricity by being the main point of contact between our guests and the Customer Experience team
  • Balance workflow processes with independent on-the-go work most of the time, and desk-based tasks (e.g., email, slack, G-suite) the rest of the time

What we’re looking for:

  • Problem solver, with ability to work in a fast-paced and "get the job done" culture
  • Enthusiasm to own a part in driving operational excellence
  • Detail-oriented
  • Confident user of technology (email, slack, G suite)
  • Access to a reliable vehicle & driver’s license for roles based in certain markets (e.g., SF/Bay Area, Seattle, Los Angeles) with reimbursement for mileage
  • A positive, driven, upbeat and friendly personality

Your benefits:

  • Be part of a fast-growing global startup that’s shaping the future of renting & living around the world
  • Competitive salary
  • Flexible paid time off
  • Enhanced parental leave
  • 401k retirement plan
  • Corporate cell phone plan
  • Competitive Health insurance (Medical, Dental and Vision), along with complimentary access to OneMedical and Health Advocate
  • Complimentary accommodation in Blueground locations. Think summer in Greece and winter in Dubai!

The role is primarily responsible for assisting our Operations Team in preparing new units, ensuring that existing units are perfect for our guests, and handling any issues or emergencies that arise. These issues include but are not limited to handling guest lockouts, emergency relocations, as well as keeping Operations Managers informed of potential repairs and actions being taken.

*Please note that this is a contractor role, covering night shifts with an on call status.

What you’ll focus on:

  • Work with our team of Operations Managers to ensure our properties are fully-equipped and move-in ready for our guests.
  • "Be Blueground's "boots on the ground" to help resolve issues impacting our guests such as handling guest concerns, requests, maintenance matters/repairs and technology issues (e.g., supervising handyman/locksmith/plumber, managing deliveries, handling building maintenance/follow-up, resolving WIFI/TV issues, etc.)
  • Perform unit check-in & check-outs before and after every guest stay to ensure each apartment meets business + guest quality standards
  • Carry out Blueground homes walkthroughs to ensure all quality assurance criteria are met when it comes to post maintenance/service requests, interiors/furnishing specifications, and overall design and aesthetics
  • Showcase your knack for custom-centricity by being the main point of contact between our guests and the Customer Experience team
  • Balance workflow processes with independent on-the-go work most of the time, and desk-based tasks (e.g., email, slack, G-suite) the rest of the time

What we’re looking for:

  • Problem solver, with ability to work in a fast-paced and "get the job done" culture
  • Enthusiasm to own a part in driving operational excellence
  • Detail-oriented
  • Confident user of technology (email, slack, G suite)
  • Access to a reliable vehicle & driver’s license for roles based in certain markets (e.g., SF/Bay Area, Seattle, Los Angeles) with reimbursement for mileage
  • A positive, driven, upbeat and friendly personality

Your benefits:

  • Be part of a fast-growing global startup that’s shaping the future of renting & living around the world
  • Competitive salary
  • Flexible paid time off
  • Enhanced parental leave
  • 401k retirement plan
  • Corporate cell phone plan
  • Competitive Health insurance (Medical, Dental and Vision), along with complimentary access to OneMedical and Health Advocate
  • Complimentary accommodation in Blueground locations. Think summer in Greece and winter in Dubai!

At Blueground we are proud to have Diversity and Inclusion at the centre of everything we do. We are committed to Equal Employment Opportunity regardless of race, color, national origin, ethnicity, gender, age, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or religion.
